address: Xã Ninh Vân, Thành phố Hoa Lư, Tỉnh Ninh Bình
thought:
**Analysis of Address Restructuring: "Xã Ninh Vân, Thành phố Hoa Lư, Tỉnh Ninh Bình"**

Okay, so I've got "Xã Ninh Vân" in "Tỉnh Ninh Bình," and the task is to pinpoint its new administrative unit. First, I focused on identifying the old ward ("Xã Ninh Vân") and province ("Tỉnh Ninh Bình").  I always start with the province; it's the broadest scope. Then I had to check the applicable resolutions.

I quickly checked the provincial-level mergers using resolution 60-NQ/TW, to see if there was any change. The resolution confirmed that Ninh Bình remained Ninh Bình after any restructuring (it wasn't part of any merger at the province level), so that part was easy.

Then, I shifted my focus to the specific ward. I scanned the relevant resolutions for "Ninh Vân" within "Tỉnh Ninh Bình." Resolution 1674/NQ-UBTVQH15, concerning administrative re-organization of the Ninh Bình province, immediately stood out. Line 124 of the resolution detailed the consolidation of Ninh Vân and other wards into a new ward. That line specified that "Xã Ninh Vân" would be merged into a new ward called "phường Nam Hoa Lư."

Finally, just to be thorough, I verified that "phường Nam Hoa Lư" was indeed in the list of new wards, which it was.  I double-checked to confirm that the province name in the new ward entry ("Tỉnh Ninh Bình") matched the original. This gives me a high degree of confidence in the finding. Therefore, I can confidently map "Xã Ninh Vân" to "Phường Nam Hoa Lư," with a reference to the relevant resolution and line. The resulting structure looks solid, and I can now construct the appropriate JSON output.

citation.header: 1674/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Ninh Bình
citation.line: 124. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của phường Ninh Phong, phường Ninh Sơn và các xã Ninh Vân, Ninh An, Ninh Hải thành phường mới có tên gọi là **phường Nam Hoa Lư**.
